# Welcome to 3K: Dynamics and Heterogeneity!

I hope you are ready! 

In the next two weeks we will set forth as comprehensive a treatment as we can in time series and panel data in ten sessions.  With coffee in hand and the computer getting ready, let's dig in!

![](thumbnail.jpg)

A *brief* summary for the Instructor's Presentation

- Week 1: Time Series
  + Stationarity and Unit Roots
  + ARMA structures
  + Dynamic Linear Models and their Interpretation
  + Cointegration topics
  + Equation balance and recent controversies
- Week 2: Panel Data
  + Fixed and random effects and Within/Between
  + STADL Up!
  + Missing data
  + GLM Extensions of Panel Models
  + Causal Inference in Panel Data [TWFE/DID]

# Digital Resources

Depending upon your software of choice, you will want to have a look over the relevant manuals.
- For Stata [ts](https://www.stata.com/manuals/ts.pdf) and [xt](https://www.stata.com/manuals/xt.pdf)
- For R there is [timetk](https://business-science.github.io/timetk/) and [fpp3](https://otexts.com/fpp3/) and [plm](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/plm/vignettes/A_plmPackage.html) along with [panelr](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/panelr/vignettes/wbm.html).
- [A `github` with the course data.](https://github.com/robertwwalker/Essex-Data)
- [A `github` with this website.](https://github.com/robertwwalker/ESSSSDA22-3K/)
- [Robert W. Walker's website](https://rww.science)
